definition: to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
lit. at home, one can spend a thousand days in comfort, but spending a day away from home can be challenging (idiom)/fig. there's no place like home
pinyin: zai4 jia1 qian1 ri4 hao3 , chu1 men2 yi1 shi2 nan2
containing_words.word: 在家千日好，出門一時難

definition: one depends on one's parents when at home, and on one's friends when away from home (idiom)
pinyin: zai4 jia1 kao4 fu4 mu3 , chu1 men2 kao4 peng2 you5
containing_words.word: 在家靠父母，出門靠朋友

definition: lit. good deeds do not go beyond the door, evil deeds spread a thousand miles/a good deed goes unnoticed, but scandal spreads fast (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 shi4 bu4 chu1 men2 , e4 shi4 chuan2 qian1 li3
containing_words.word: 好事不出門，惡事傳千里

definition: a learned person need not leave his home to know what's going on in the world (idiom)
pinyin: xiu4 cai5 bu4 chu1 men2 , quan2 zhi1 tian1 xia4 shi4
containing_words.word: 秀才不出門，全知天下事

definition: a learned person need not leave his home to know what's going on in the world (idiom)
pinyin: xiu4 cai5 bu4 chu1 men2 , neng2 zhi1 tian1 xia4 shi4
containing_words.word: 秀才不出門，能知天下事

sentences.english: Just go out and shoot as much as you can and try different things.
sentences.chinese: 出門能照多少就照多少，嘗試不同的東西。

sentences.english: When we go out, snow also seems to be harder.
sentences.chinese: 等我們出門時，雪似乎也越下越大了。

sentences.english: He goes out in the rain, he walks in the water, he travels in winter.
sentences.chinese: 他常在下雨時出門，在水裏行走，在嚴冬旅行。

sentences.english: He drives his own car everywhere and does not have a driver or security people around him.
sentences.chinese: 他都自己開車出門，也沒有請司機或保全人員跟着他。

sentences.english: Most children do, from the time they go to secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我相信大部分孩子從中學起就經常會獨自出門。

sentences.english: Next time she goes out, she’ll know better.
sentences.chinese: 下次她出門，就會知道咋辦了。

sentences.english: When the bell rang, the pupils ran helter-skelter out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 下課鈴響時，學生們蜂擁衝出門去。

sentences.english: B lion at home, a mouse abroad.
sentences.chinese: 在家是獸王，出門是耗子。

sentences.english: Old spent hens escorted out a small gray doves, flowers fort immediately face became pale and long.
sentences.chinese: 等老花母雞扶着小灰鴿一出門，花堡長立刻臉色大變。

sentences.english: Unsold tickets for some event were available to the purchase at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有些項目未售出門卷可以在場外入口處有售。

sentences.english: And if they don’t, then out the door they go.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有，那就把它們送出門。

sentences.english: Injections of tens of thousands take medicine, go out empty-handed back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 打針吃藥好幾萬，空手出門空手返。

sentences.english: Good maps are a necessity to travelers.
sentences.chinese: 好的地圖是出門旅行辯芻可少的。

sentences.english: Everybody should be careful hile going out.
sentences.chinese: 每個人出門都應多加小心。

sentences.english: One day, Hugo heard that her father and brothers were away.
sentences.chinese: 一天，雨果聽說她的父兄幾人都出門往了。

not bad/tolerable/fortunately

as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton

to go to bed/to sleep
to arrive late
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
